name: Gordon Ramsay
description: Gordon Ramsay is a world-renowned chef known for his fiery personality and Michelin-starred restaurants. He has hosted several popular cooking shows, including Hell's Kitchen and MasterChef.

recipes.cooking_method: Sear the beef fillet, coat it with a mushroom duxelle, wrap in parma ham and puff pastry, and bake until golden brown.
Gently whisk eggs and cook on low heat with butter, stirring continuously, then add cream and seasoning.
Rub lamb with garlic and rosemary, coat with Dijon mustard and breadcrumbs, and roast until desired doneness.

name: Jamie Oliver
description: Jamie Oliver is a British chef and advocate for healthy eating. His approachable cooking style has made him a household name, with numerous cookbooks and TV shows to his credit.

recipes.cooking_method: Bread and fry the chicken breast, top with tomato sauce and cheese, and bake until golden and bubbly.
Sauté vegetables in a hot pan with garlic, then toss in soy sauce for a quick stir-fry.
Roll out pizza dough, spread tomato sauce, add mozzarella, drizzle with olive oil, and bake until crust is crispy.

name: Alice Waters
description: Alice Waters is a pioneer of the farm-to-table movement. She is the founder of Chez Panisse, a famous restaurant in Berkeley, California, and has been a key advocate for organic and locally grown food.

recipes.cooking_method: Roast beets until tender, slice and serve with goat cheese, arugula, walnuts, and balsamic dressing.
Grill asparagus with olive oil and garlic, then drizzle with lemon juice and sprinkle with Parmesan.
Simmer tomatoes, onions, and garlic in vegetable broth, blend until smooth, and add fresh basil.

name: Thomas Keller
description: Thomas Keller is one of the most respected chefs in the United States, best known for his meticulous approach to French cuisine. He runs The French Laundry, a three-Michelin-star restaurant in Napa Valley.

recipes.cooking_method: Slow-cook duck legs in duck fat with garlic and thyme until tender and crispy.
Layer sliced vegetables in a baking dish, drizzle with olive oil, and roast until tender.
Sauté vegetables, add lobster shells, simmer with cognac and cream, and blend for a smooth bisque.

name: Ina Garten
description: Ina Garten, also known as the Barefoot Contessa, is beloved for her simple yet elegant recipes. She has written numerous cookbooks and hosts a popular cooking show on Food Network.

recipes.cooking_method: Roast chicken with lemon, garlic, and rosemary until golden and juicy.
Simmer tomato sauce with vodka and cream, then toss with cooked penne and Parmesan.
Mix ingredients and bake until moist and fluffy, then frost with rich chocolate icing.

name: Wolfgang Puck
description: Wolfgang Puck is a global culinary icon with a blend of French, Asian, and Californian cooking styles. His innovative approach has made him a leader in the world of modern fusion cuisine.

recipes.cooking_method: Mix diced tuna with soy sauce and sriracha, serve on avocado slices drizzled with sesame oil.
Cook Arborio rice slowly in chicken broth, stir in mushrooms and Parmesan, finish with truffle oil.
Bake pizza dough, spread with cream cheese, top with smoked salmon, dill, and capers.
